2024-stage.title: I3S Laboratory Internship
2024-stage.description: One-month internship at I3S laboratory affiliated with CNRS. Research project on nonograms and constraint programming.

2023.title: 1st year Integrated Prep
2023.description: Basics in algorithms, data structures, programming.

nonogram.description: This I3S lab internship project explores constraint programming applied to Nonograms: generation, Regular & Ternary solver models, and performance analysis across size, density, and structure.
nonogram.details: The platform generates both controlled random grids (density 0.1 to 0.9) and image-derived Nonograms, extracts constraints automatically, and feeds two Choco-Solver models (Regular via automaton and Ternary via elemental transitions).
nonogram.conclusion: Analysis shows image-based Nonograms are more structured and easier, the Ternary model excels on small random grids, while the Regular model remains efficient up to 200×200 puzzles.
nonogram.generation: Random generation with density control, automatic block extraction, and conversion of images into binary grids.
nonogram.resolution: Two Choco-Solver solvers: Regular ensures sequences via finite automaton, Ternary breaks constraints into elemental transitions.
nonogram.analysis: Study on grid-size/density impact (intermediate densities hardest) plus solver comparison across diverse structures.
nonogram.learnings: Nonograms are NP-hard, runtimes grow quickly, generation may lack uniqueness, and structured puzzles are easier to solve.

project.description: This project was specifically developed to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Faculty of Pharmacy of Monastir. It is a complete registration platform for the marathon and marchaton organized as part of this anniversary.
project.details: The site integrates a user registration system with data validation, participant management and administration interface to retrieve all registered users' information. Particular attention was paid to user experience and data security.
project.conclusion: This platform efficiently centralized event registrations while providing organizers with a complete and intuitive management tool.

pharmathon.description: This project was specifically developed to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Faculty of Pharmacy of Monastir. It is a complete registration platform for the marathon and marchaton organized as part of this anniversary.
pharmathon.details: The site integrates a user registration system with data validation, participant management and administration interface to retrieve all registered users' information. Particular attention was paid to user experience and data security.
pharmathon.conclusion: This platform efficiently centralized event registrations while providing organizers with a complete and intuitive management tool.

forum.description: Event platform developed for the Research Forum of the Faculty of Pharmacy of Monastir. The system enables complete management of scientific events with paid registrations and participant tracking.
forum.details: The application integrates three distinct interfaces: an admin interface to manage users and add events to the calendar, a participant interface to register and make payments, and a speaker interface to view attendance statistics and manage their sessions.
forum.conclusion: This comprehensive solution facilitated forum organization by automating registration and payment management while providing real-time tracking tools for all event stakeholders.

dinary.description: Revolutionary mobile payment application developed for the Algerian market. Dinary offers a complete QR code payment solution with sophisticated architecture featuring three distinct interfaces: Client, Merchant, and Administrator.
dinary.details: The application integrates a robust backend entirely developed with advanced features: secure authentication system, merchant geolocation on interactive map, referral system, multi-level rewards program, and real-time transaction management. The admin interface provides total control with identity verification tools, merchant moderation, and detailed analytics.
dinary.conclusion: This ambitious project demonstrates complete full-stack development mastery with particular attention to financial transaction security and user experience in the context of Algeria's mobile payment market.
